raw_text:
Curbishley delight for Johansson
 
 Charlton manager Alan Curbishley paid tribute to two-goal striker Jonatan Johansson after beating Norwich.
 
 Curbishley said after the 4-0 win: "There was talk about Norwich being interested in the summer but I have a lot of faith in Jonatan. "When there was talk of other clubs I just told him he was going nowhere. "He's part of our squad and he got us a couple of important goals early on. I'm sure he's happy here, but I was delighted with all the players." Curbishley was subjected to criticism from Charlton fans recently, and he said: "The thing about this club is that we have got where we are by all pulling in the same direction. "That's happened for however long I've been here and we don't want people taking sides."
llama3.2:1b: Alan Curbishley paid tribute to Jonatan Johansson after Charlton beat Norwich 4-0, saying he is part of the squad and contributed important goals.
llama3.2:3b: Charlton manager Alan Curbishley praised Jonatan Johansson after a 4-0 win over Norwich, saying he has faith in the striker and was delighted with all players despite recent criticism from fans.
gemma2:2b: Alan Curbishley praised Jonatan Johansson's two goals, which helped Charlton beat Norwich 4-0.  Curbishley expressed confidence in Johansson's future with the club. He also acknowledged recent criticism from fans while emphasizing team unity.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Alan Curbishley pays tribute to Jonatan Johansson after Norwich beat him, praising his role as a two-goal striker. He also stated that he has faith in Johansson's potential at Charlton. Curbishley acknowledged the club's direction and noted they are "by all pulling in the same direction."
qwen2.5:1.5b: Curbishley praises Jonatan Johansson for helping Charlton win 4-0 against Norwich, emphasizing faith in him despite earlier doubts. He also addresses criticism from fans, stressing teamwork and unity at the club.
qwen2.5:3b: Charlton manager Alan Curbishley praised Jonatan Johansson, who scored twice against Norwich, after their 4-0 win. Despite recent criticism from fans, Curbishley expressed faith in Johansson, stating he will remain at the club. He emphasized that maintaining unity within the team is crucial for Charlton's success.
opencoder:1.5b: "Alan Curbishley paid tribute to Jonatan Johansson after Norwich, winning two-goal during a 4-0 win where he talked about his future potential in the summer. He showed respect for the manager, critical players and fans in the recent discussion on other clubs."
smollm:1.7b: Curbishley was delighted with Jonatan Johansson after beating Norwich, saying he was part of their squad and had a lot of faith in him. He praised his players' work early on and said he was happy with the way they worked together as a team. Curbishley told him that he got along well with the other players at the club, but added that he would be disappointed if they didn't continue to pull in the same direction.

Alan Curbishley paid tribute to Jonatan Johansson after Charlie Hill's Charlton team secured a 4-0 victory over Norwich. Curbishley acknowledged the interest Norwich expressed but stressed that the club had always moved in tandem, making it unfair for players to split their views. He told Johansson he was going nowhere and that he too was on the same path, highlighting his confidence in him despite the potential for others to swing differently.
tinyllama:1.1b: Curbishley-El-Hey for Johansson: Curbishley paid tribute to Norwich forward Jonatan Johansson after a 4-0 victory over the Canaries. He was quoted as saying that while there were speculations of interest from other clubs, he did not have to worry about finding a new home for Johansson. He praised him for scoring two crucial goals early on in the match and called him a "part of our squad." He was also satisfied with the overall performance and attitude of his players at Charlton Athletic.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Curbishley expressed his delight at securing a crucial win against Norwich, praising striker Jonatan Johansson for his contribution to the team. Noting that Charlton has been fortunate enough to maintain their position in the Premier League, Curbishley also shared his optimism about the future of the squad and emphasized that he was delighted with all the players. Despite facing backlash from some fans, Curbishley remains focused on building a winning team within the club's budget and continuing to provide stability for the current crop of players.

The manager expressed confidence in Johansson's future with the club and thanked all players for their efforts. Curbishley also addressed recent criticism from fans, emphasizing that Charlton's success is the result of teamwork and unity among all members.
